subject: Re: [junit] How to test database applications
msgSnippet: Open a transaction in the setUp() method, and make it rollback in tearDown().  That way you can make any changes you like in your testX() methods and they

Open a transaction in the setUp() method, and make it rollback in 
tearDown().  That way you can make any changes you like in your testX() 
methods and they won't ever be committed to the database.

Will

j3ca wrote:

> I'm thinking of using JUnit to test my applications. They rely 
> heavily on data from databases. How do I test a database application 
> whit JUnit where I can't change data in the database?
>
